channel.title: BBC News - Entertainment and Arts
channel.description: The latest stories from the Entertainment and Arts section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: VIDEO: Meet the Author: Jo Marchant
item.description: Jo Marchant talks to the BBC's Nick Higham about her new book The Shadow King which tells the story of Tutankhamun's mummy

item.title: VIDEO: The family circus aged two to 66
item.description: Performing in the circus is a family affair for 66-year-old grandfather and amateur clown Alain Carabinier.

item.title: VIDEO: 'People wonder if I have the capability'
item.description: Myleene Klass has revealed she was concerned people questioned her "capability" to do her job because of her background in a pop band.

item.title: VIDEO: Robson Green's fishing tips
item.description: Robson Green talks to BBC Breakfast about his fishing adventures and new book .

item.title: VIDEO: Dynamo tricks Breakfast's Louise
item.description: British magician Dynamo works his magic on the BBC Breakfast sofa

item.title: VIDEO: Female pair compete for Apprentice win
item.description: This year's Apprentice finalists talk about their winning strategy with BBC breakfast

item.title: VIDEO: The fabric of Nigeria and other arts stories
item.description: The work of London-born Nigerian artist Yinka Shonibare MBE comes to Yorkshire, the Montreux Jazz Festival gets some non-jazzy names - and other stories from the world of arts.

item.title: AUDIO: Cerys Matthews on Wales' referendum hopes
item.description: Singer and broadcaster Cerys Matthews examines if the Welsh look enviously, or nervously, at the choice that Scottish voters have.

item.title: VIDEO: Appeal to find stars of Sooty film
item.description: A search is on for the children who starred alongside Sooty and Sweep in a film made more than 50 years ago.

item.title: VIDEO: Film world circles around Snowden story
item.description: One short movie about Edward Snowden has already been made - and at least one big-name director has expressed an interest in making a feature film.

item.title: VIDEO: Simon Pegg at World's End premiere
item.description: Simon Pegg, Nick Frost and Edgar Wright have unveiled their new film The World's End in London tonight.

item.title: VIDEO: K-pop star ends military service
item.description: Hundreds of fans wait outside Seoul's Defence Ministry to cheer South Korean pop singer and actor Rain as he is released from mandatory military service.

item.title: AUDIO: Branagh's Macbeth 'not without danger'
item.description: Sir Kenneth Branagh's says that his first production and appearance as Macbeth is "not without danger".

item.title: VIDEO: Head of Bolshoi Theatre sacked
item.description: The head of the Bolshoi Theatre, Anatoly Iskanov, has been sacked after a series of scandals.

item.title: VIDEO: Quatro: Why I turned down Elvis
item.description: Rock and Roll singer Suzi Quatro talks about her life in the music business and why she turned down an invitation to sing for Elvis Presley

item.title: VIDEO: Korean conflict seen through art
item.description: An exhibition has opened in London to mark the 60th anniversary of the ceasefire that brought an end to the Korean War.

item.title: VIDEO: Magician Dynamo on 'toughest' gig
item.description: The 30-year-old says he had to break through Samuel L. Jackson's "icy persona" when the star appeared on his new show.

item.title: VIDEO: Gibney: 'Why I made Wikileaks film'
item.description: Director Alex Gibney explains why he made a film about the Wikileaks story.

item.title: VIDEO: Virtuoso who plays piano and iPad
item.description: Conrad Tao tells the BBC why being a virtuoso pianist isn't enough. He also uses an tablet computer to combine tradition and technology to attract a younger audience.

item.title: AUDIO: Derren: 'I'm banned from casinos'
item.description: Illusionist Derren Brown tells 5 live why he has been banned from casinos around the UK.

item.title: VIDEO: Freddie Mercury gorilla removed
item.description: A gorilla sculpture painted as Freddie Mercury has been removed and will be repainted because a charity claimed it infringes copyright.

item.title: VIDEO: How 1980s club kids influenced fashion
item.description: The V&A's Summer Exhibition 'Club to Catwalk' explores the influence of underground club culture on couture fashion of the 1980s.

item.title: VIDEO: Dame Helen: From monarch to monster
item.description: She is best known for her portrayal of the Queen, but for her latest role Dame Helen Mirren has taken on an altogether more "scary" challenge.

item.title: VIDEO: The Rolling Stones Rock Hyde Park
item.description: Forty four years after they first played there, The Rolling Stones returned to Hyde park to play a concert for 44 thousand fans

item.title: VIDEO: Celebrations for 100 years of Indian cinema
item.description: Bollywood stars celebrated 100 years of Indian Cinema at the International Indian Film Academy Awards

item.title: VIDEO: Five Minutes With: Danny Baker
item.description: Broadcaster Danny Baker talks to Matthew Stadlen about why he talks so fast, his father, the secret of good radio, cancer and why he was never "in love" with football

item.title: VIDEO: Film Review - the week's new films
item.description: Film critic Mark Kermode reviews the week's new releases including The Bling Ring, A Field in England and Now You See Me.

item.title: VIDEO: First Scot graduates from the Bolshoi
item.description: Hayley Stobo is the first Scot to graduate from the Bolshoi Ballet Academy in Moscow.

item.title: VIDEO: Wanted 'warm up' before they sing
item.description: Nathan Sykes from The Wanted says he now prepares better for concerts after having surgery on his vocal cords.

item.title: VIDEO: Getting to grips with Private Lives
item.description: After a successful run at the Chichester Festival Theatre, director Jonathan Kent's take on Noel Coward's Private Lives opens in the West End

item.title: VIDEO: Griff Rhys Jones tracks dad's war
item.description: Comedian and actor Griff Rhys Jones' latest programme charts his journey through the jungles of Burma uncovering his father's time in the army during World War II

item.title: VIDEO: Nicky Wire gives Lions prediction
item.description: Ahead of the British and Irish Lions decider game against Australia, Nicky Wire of the Manic Street Preachers, who is following the tour, gives his prediction for the match.

item.title: VIDEO: Elba and Hunnam's alien battle
item.description: Brit actors Idris Elba and Charlie Hunnam have teamed up with Mexican director Guillermo Del Toro for his robot v alien flick Pacific Rim

item.title: AUDIO: Brit film hits big and small screens
item.description: Actor Michael Smiley on why Brit flick 'A Field in England' is being simultaneously released at the cinema, on DVD, TV and online.

item.title: VIDEO: Bling Ring burglar 'developing show'
item.description: Nick Prugo reveals he is in talks for his own TV show after the release of the movie The Bling Ring, which was based on his life.

item.title: VIDEO: Emma Watson on The Bling Ring
item.description: Emma Watson talks to Radio 1's Newsbeat about her role in Sofia Coppola's latest movie The Bling Ring

item.title: VIDEO: Meet The Author: Charlotte Grimshaw
item.description: In this week's Meet the Author, Nick Higham meets Charlotte Grimshaw, a leading author from New Zealand.

item.title: VIDEO: Sir Walter Scott's former home opens
item.description: Author Sir Walter Scott's former home in the Scottish Borders has undergone a Â£12 million restoration programme and has been officially opened by the Queen.

item.title: VIDEO: Someone like you: Adele gets waxwork
item.description: A wax work of Adele has been unveiled at Madame Tussauds in London.

item.title: VIDEO: Suicide bomb film in Arab boycott
item.description: A new film called The Attack film has been banned in much of the Middle East because its Lebanese director shot the film in Israel with Israeli actors contravening a 1955 Lebanese Anti-Israel Boycott Law.

item.title: VIDEO: Richard Madeley on his debut novel
item.description: TV presenter Richard Madeley tells BBC Breakfast how he is following in his wife's footsteps by penning a novel

item.title: VIDEO: Prince Charles meets Doctor Who
item.description: Prince Charles came face to face with a Dalek when he visited the Doctor Who set in Cardiff.

item.title: VIDEO: Football as ballet - and other arts stories
item.description: A Norwegian dance company turns the beautiful game into ballet, a slice of Johannesburg's thriving art scene comes to Paris - and other stories from the world of arts.

item.title: AUDIO: Wallander author on lure of Africa
item.description: The Swedish author of the Kurt Wallander novels has spoken of his fascination with Africa.

item.title: VIDEO: Can a 'Magic' film trick audiences?
item.description: Jesse Eisenberg and Isla Fisher talk about their latest magical Hollywood experience

item.title: AUDIO: Lennox: 'human right' to be HIV free
item.description: Singer songwriter Annie Lennox has been speaking at the Aspen Ideas festival about mother to child HIV transmission.

item.title: VIDEO: Rogers' delight with Glastonbury show
item.description: Kenny Rogers has defended 'berating' his audience at the Glastonbury festival for their singing.

item.title: VIDEO: Moyet: 'I'm a musician not a celebrity'
item.description: Alison Moyet is releasing a new album which has been described as a musical resurrection.

item.title: VIDEO: What happens to Glastonbury rubbish?
item.description: After the show, the clear-up begins, but what happens to the tonnes of litter generated by Glastonbury's huge crowds?

item.title: VIDEO: Cameron: 'I'd be Harry Potter'
item.description: David Cameron has chosen child-wizard Harry Potter as the JK Rowling character he would most like to be

item.title: AUDIO: 'The day my skirt fell off on stage'
item.description: Actress Maureen Lipman discusses mishaps that have occurred on stage over the years.

item.title: VIDEO: Attenborough honour
item.description: Sir David Attenborough is presented with an honorary degree for services to science and broadcasting by Queen's University, Belfast.

item.title: VIDEO: Bullock on photoshopping claims
item.description: Oscar-winning actress Sandra Bullock addresses speculation that the UK posters of The Heat have been airbrushed.

item.title: VIDEO: Meet the modern St Cuthbert
item.description: With the Lindisfarne Gospels on display in Durham, a statue of St Cuthbert has been unveiled as a centrepiece to the exhibition.

item.title: VIDEO: Gok wants to 'help people feel good'
item.description: Stylist and fashion expert Gok Wan is presenting a new series aimed at helping women to feel confident about wearing a bikini.

item.title: VIDEO: 'My dad never said "I love you"'
item.description: Actor Lenny Henry says the character he plays in Fences has brought praise from an audience reminded of their own father or husband.

item.title: VIDEO: Kenny Rogers 'thrilled' with debut
item.description: Country star Kenny Rogers made his Glastonbury debut to a delighted crowd who sang along to his hits.

item.title: VIDEO: How street cat named Bob saved busker
item.description: Busker-turned-author James Bowen explains how his cat Bob became the most popular author his publisher has ever known.

item.title: VIDEO: Glasto witnesses 'swagger of Jagger'
item.description: The Rolling Stones have made their Glastonbury debut, 43 years after the festival first took place.

item.title: VIDEO: Behind the scenes: Pyramid Stage
item.description: The BBC's Lucy Hockings has been behind the scenes at the Pyramid Stage at Glastonbury where The Rolling Stones are due to perform on Saturday night.

item.title: AUDIO: When Humphrys met Jagger
item.description: The Rolling Stones are one of the headline acts at this weekend's Glastonbury Festival.

item.title: VIDEO: War photography's window into conflict
item.description: A new photo exhibit in Washington DC portrays war and its aftermath, bringing the daily realities of conflict to people who may have never seen war.

item.title: VIDEO: Film Review - the week's new releases
item.description: Film critic Mark Kermode reviews the week's new releases, including The East, Despicable Me 2 and The Act of Killing.

item.title: VIDEO: Dennis Potter works on display
item.description: Unpublished works by playwright Dennis Potter are on display in a special exhibition in the Forest of Dean this weekend.

item.title: AUDIO: The hunt for stolen Mandela painting
item.description: The New York Police Department, Interpol and private investigators are all involved in the hunt for a valuable portrait of Nelson Mandela stolen in New York.

item.title: VIDEO: Life after Bieber for Mally the monkey
item.description: Mally the six-month-old capuchin monkey and former pet of Justin Bieber starts a new life at a safari park in northern Germany after a period in quarantine.

item.title: AUDIO: Congo history haunts new production
item.description: The cast and crew of the first British production of A Season in the Congo have spoken of the impact a visit to the country had on them.

item.title: VIDEO: Carell tight-lipped on Anchorman 2
item.description: The actor says he thinks Anchorman 2 "will be funny" based on the laughter during filming.

item.title: VIDEO: Glastonbury: Morning after night before
item.description: Organisers are clearing up after the first night of the Glastonbury Festival's first night, when the Arctic Monkey's played to more than 90,000 fans.

item.title: VIDEO: Damp Glastonbury gets under way
item.description: The Glastonbury Festival has begun with acts including Rita Ora, Chic, Dizzee Rascal and Arctic Monkeys due to take to the stage on Friday.

item.title: VIDEO: Medieval plays performed in Chester
item.description: More than 300 local people are preparing to take centre stage at Chester Cathedral for the opening of the Chester Mystery Plays.

item.title: VIDEO: Cuba's amazing dancing triplets
item.description: Identical triplets Angel, Cesar and Marcos Ramirez Castellano are top young ballet dancers at the elite feeder school for Cuba's National Ballet.
